title: Germany bans far-right group accused of indoctrinating children
description: Police raided dozens of properties after the German interior ministry said it had banned the Artgemeinschaft group, which it accused of spreading a Nazi worldview.

title: Deadly blaze at Iraq wedding party leaves at least 100 dead
description: A wedding celebration in Iraq turned tragic when a fire killed more than 100 people and injured at least 150 others. Officials say the inferno may have been started by fireworks set off before the couple’s first dance.

title: Biden admin announces Israel's entry into the Visa Waiver Program
description: Israeli citizens are joining an exclusive club that will allow visa-free entry to the United States with entry into the U.S. Visa Waiver Program, the U.S. will announce.

title: North Korea to expel American soldier who crossed border
description: North Korea has expelled Travis King, the American soldier who crossed over the border there in July and had been detained there ever since. Pyongyang says it has finished their questioning of King. NBC’s Janis Mackey Frayer reports for TODAY.

title: Young climate activists take European governments to human rights court
description: Six young people from Portugal argued that governments across Europe aren’t doing enough to protect people from the harms of climate change at the European Court of Human Rights.

title: Zoleka Mandela, Nelson Mandela's granddaughter, dies at 43
description: Zoleka Mandela, a granddaughter of Nelson Mandela whose life was tangled up in addiction, a suicide attempt, a battle with cancer and the tragedy of losing two young children before she came back from the shadows to embrace his legacy, has died.

title: Raging inferno kills around 100 people at wedding in northern Iraq
description: Around 100 people were killed after a fire broke out at a Christian wedding in northern Iraq and authorities warned the death toll could rise further.

title: Young climate activists take on European nations in a landmark court case
description: Six young people from Portugal will argue that governments across Europe aren’t doing enough to protect people from the harms of climate change at the European Court of Human Rights on Wednesday, in the latest and largest instance of activists taking governments to court to force climate action.

title: Germany bans far-right group that tried to indoctrinate children with Nazi ideology
description: The German government on Wednesday banned a far-right, racist group known for its indoctrination of children as police raided dozens of homes of its members and other buildings early in the morning.

title: Thousands of ethnic Armenians flee Nagorno-Karabakh due to violence
description: Thousands of ethnic Armenians are fleeing their homes from Nagaorno-Karabakh. The mass exodus come after a military operation by Azerbaijan.

title: At least 100 dead, 150 injured in fire at  a wedding hall in Iraq
description: A fire at a wedding hall in northern Iraq killed at least 100 people and injured 150 others, authorities said Wednesday.
